question: Arrange the following compounds in their decreasing order of reactivity towards Nucleophilic addition reaction.
CH3COCH3, CH3COC2H5, CH3CHO
explanation: Aldehydes are more reactive than ketones due to steric and electronic reasons. Among ketones, less sterically hindered ones are more reactive. Order: Acetaldehyde > Acetone > Methyl ethyl ketone [cite: 946-955].
